      "source": [
        "# Interactive pH Titration Simulator\n",
        "\n",
        "This notebook simulates the titration of a strong acid with a strong base\n",
        "and plots the pH curve dynamically."
      ]
    },

      "source": [
        "\n",
        "!pip install ipywidgets -q\n",
        "\n",
        "import numpy as np\n",
        "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
        "import ipywidgets as widgets\n",
        "from IPython.display import display\n",
        "\n",
        "def titration(acid_conc=0.1, base_conc=0.1):\n",
        "    volumes = np.linspace(0, 50, 100)\n",
        "    pH_values = []\n",
        "\n",
        "    for v in volumes:\n",
        "        moles_acid = acid_conc * 50\n",
        "        moles_base = base_conc * v\n",
        "\n",
        "        if moles_base < moles_acid:\n",
        "            H = (moles_acid - moles_base) / (50 + v)\n",
        "            pH = -np.log10(H)\n",
        "        elif moles_base == moles_acid:\n",
        "            pH = 7\n",
        "        else:\n",
        "            OH = (moles_base - moles_acid) / (50 + v)\n",
        "            pH = 14 + np.log10(OH)\n",
        "\n",
        "        pH_values.append(pH)\n",
        "\n",
        "    plt.plot(volumes, pH_values)\n",
        "    plt.xlabel(\"Volume of Base Added (mL)\")\n",
        "    plt.ylabel(\"pH\")\n",
        "    plt.title(\"Titration Curve\")\n",
        "    plt.show()\n",
        "\n",
        "widgets.interact(titration,\n",
        "                 acid_conc=widgets.FloatSlider(value=0.1, min=0.05, max=1.0, step=0.05),\n",
        "                 base_conc=widgets.FloatSlider(value=0.1, min=0.05, max=1.0, step=0.05))"
      ]
    }
